meta.description: Current navigational state of the vessel

The magnetic variation (declination) at the current position that must be added to the magnetic heading to derive the true heading. Easterly variations are positive and Westerly variations are negative (in Radians).
The current true north heading of the vessel, equals 'headingMagnetic adjusted for magneticVariation'

headline.value: High Surf Advisory issued January 7 at 2:51PM PST until January 9 at 10:00PM PST by NWS San Francisco CA

description.value:
* WHAT...Large breaking waves up to 22 feet, strong rip currents
and sneaker waves.

* WHERE...Pacific Coast from Sonoma county to Monterey county,
excluding Northern Monterey Bay.

* WHEN...From 1 AM Thursday to 10 PM PST Friday.

* IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for sneaker waves, strong
rip currents, and beach erosion. Large breaking waves can
overpower swimmers resulting in significant physical injury
and increase the risk of drowning.

instruction.value:
Swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf
conditions.

areaDesc.value: San Francisco; Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; San Francisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast

meta.description: Mode of the vessel based on the current conditions. Can be combined with navigation.state to control vessel signals eg switch to night mode for instrumentation and lights, or make sound signals for fog.
